website_summaries.verdict: Grizzly Gear's bars are denser in caloric content than many others, offering a decent price value.
pros: These bars have a lemon vanilla flavor, and aren't too different from a shortbread cookie
They're pretty easy to chew, which is good for children and the elderly
cons: The smell is unpleasant for some

customer_reviews.title: BAIT & SWITCH WARNING!!!
customer_reviews.text: 0 STARS!!! BAIT AND SWITCH. I bought one of each food ration to try prior to buying a case for my trip. This was supposed to be Grizzly gear sugar cookie... i received the mainstay coconut bars also noted see pictur for date. Purchased 5/17 and these were made 12/14. And 2 of the 10 packs were damaged not vacum sealed.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron O.

customer_reviews.title: Don't judge these food rations by their smell
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for our emergency food storage. I busted into one of them to see what they taste like. They smell pretty bad - kind of reminded me of an old grease smell. However, they taste nothing like they smell. The taste reminds me of a dry sugar cookie, just not that sweet. We could definitely eat these as survival food if needed. I only gave four stars because of the smell. Other than that, they're good. We'll be buying another case as soon as we can.
customer_reviews.author: P.G.

customer_reviews.title: Bars were almost 2 years old when shipped
customer_reviews.text: As stated in most of the low-star reviews, check your product immediately after you receive it. I ordered Jan 2018 and the bars that arrived were manufactured 4/2016, so almost 2 of the 5 year shelf life were already burned through which defeats the point of emergency bars. Also, one of the bars came with its vacuum seal failed so I assume that one wasn't even safe to eat. Just sent it back. Otherwise the product itself is great - just inventory management seems poor.
customer_reviews.author: Slim

customer_reviews.title: At this price, I expect them to come sealed...
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give five stars. I contacted the seller letting them know I got 2 out of 10 unsealed. It's been a week and no word back. Poor service. Poor product. A few of mine weren't even labeled with a lot number or expiration date. Seems like this happens a bit. Buy from someone else if you are looking for 25 year shelf life because these don't make it here sealed. Hate to rely on these in an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsey

customer_reviews.title: Good survival food good value
customer_reviews.text: Bought one individually before to taste test and the taste isnt bad. It's betteer than other survival food I tried. The box it came in could have been taped up better but everything inside seems to have survived shipping well and shipping was timely. They are made new like the individual one I bought. Mine were made in October 2015 and are good untill October 2020. It is a case of 10 as described. 1 pouch is a 3 day ration and there is 10 pouches in a 30 day supply. A case of 10 isnt very big which makes them easy to store in a closet or something and a box weighs about 10 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Sgt. Slab Wrankle Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: great for what it is: *emergency* food rations
customer_reviews.text: This will keep you on you feet in a pinch, and it tastes like lemon shortbread... albeit the lemon flavor and butter make it painfully obvious they are chemical imitations. I used this for a couple of days of backpacking in the Sipsey Wilderness of Alabama. It provided me plenty of energy and was easy to digest; however, I was getting a bit sick after a steady diet of this stuff. I'd definitely not rely on this as a staple for more than one or two days; however, it's great for what it is: rough-n-ready calories.
customer_reviews.author: David Dietrich

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Camping!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as a calorie source while staying active as a family outdoors. First appearance is dry, but once it touches your tongue it becomes oily. Not thirst-provoking either. Kid approved! But now I may need to buy more. LOL. Children were convinced that they were cookies and I was happy knowing they ate a high calorie source while staying active with multiple nutrients. Tastes like a very slight lemon sugar cookie overall. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Adam Storer

customer_reviews.title: Emergency food for the possibility of hard times.
customer_reviews.text: High caloric cookies. This beats having to resort to cannibalism in a time of starvation. (The Donner Party would have appreciated these back then). They taste good & keep us alive in hard times. Nuff said.
customer_reviews.author: John W. Leggett

customer_reviews.title: Opened packages inside
customer_reviews.text: I should have listened to the other reviews. Several of the pouches were not sealed so I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Tryan42

customer_reviews.title: Great tasting, a little oily for my stomach
customer_reviews.text: Great tasting, a little oily for my stomach. One of the vacuum packages was broke, but I wanted to try one before I stowed them anyway so as long as it was only one I was fine with it... If all had been fully seal I'd of given it a 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D

customer_reviews.title: No more worries
customer_reviews.text: Buy this and stop worrying this has a 5 year shelf life and only wiegh in at 10 lbs for a months supply. Great for your Bob or survival kit. I'm excited to see how it tastes but you know as I do if your starving you'll eat anything.
customer_reviews.author: Ja Ja

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tasted one yet but I hear it taste like a sugar cookie without much sugar all my ten food rations were in good condition I just need to try one
customer_reviews.author: Angel97v

customer_reviews.title: Great ration to keep in the truck
customer_reviews.text: Great ration to keep in the truck. Flavor is not great, but it is an emergency ration. what do you expect? Great product
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher

customer_reviews.title: Well that is great except when i opened it i saw one of ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought a case on June 25, 2015, I never opened the case until Yesterday, this supposed to have a shelf life of 5 years. Well that is great except when i opened it i saw one of the packets, while sealed, was not "vacuum" sealed. the vacuum process had failed, Of course it is too late to do anything about it. 70 bucks down the drain. I would not buy this product from this seller. If i could give zero stars I would.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Crappy packaging
customer_reviews.text: Product tastes actually pretty good, Unfortunately I had to open two of them and re vacuum seal them due to package being damaged and unable to store for long term!!
customer_reviews.author: weston

customer_reviews.title: but it make u sleep a ill better knowing u have them
customer_reviews.text: Haven't tried them...put up for emergencies...but it make u sleep a ill better knowing u have them
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product, no air leaks in any of the packages, taste is great for a survival ration.
customer_reviews.author: E.Krauss

customer_reviews.title: the taste was great, product was as described
customer_reviews.text: One of the ten 3600 calorie packages had lost its vacuum seal. Otherwise, the taste was great, product was as described.
customer_reviews.author: MacTurner

customer_reviews.title: But I still think it's a fairly good product.
customer_reviews.text: A bit too much sugar for me. It feels similar to chewing on sugar cubes. But I still think it's a fairly good product.
customer_reviews.author: Ira K.

customer_reviews.title: Much tastier than the other survival bricks, and they are great in a pinch if you need them everyday.
customer_reviews.text: These are the best I've seen and tasted and an excellent value as well. The hint of lemon really makes them actually tasty. I could easily include these as an everyday food item LONG TERM as long as there was other food available for some variety...If I had to eat these and nothing else, I think I could go as long as I had to. I'd say a month easy, they are that tasty compared to the other survival bricks. I even use these in a pinch now when I don't want to deal with cooking, don't have time, on the go etc...so I highly recommend them as a great utility food.
customer_reviews.author: CentralScrutinizer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I havent tasted them, but its a lot of calories for the $.. And stores well !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: flstc

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic. I use this for making homemade items like bath bombs and fizzies. Ordered this brand several times
customer_reviews.author: Squarah FInster

customer_reviews.title: Loose packaging out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 30 day and 1/3 of the vacuum sealed packages were not sealed so wtf, the product itself is not bad- I guess constipation would be useful in a shtf scenario... I recommend ordering 1 pack at a time and be ready to return it. I personally will not order any more.
customer_reviews.author: William Keating

product_meta.title: Emergency Food Rations Case of 10-3600 Calorie Bars - 30 Day Supply- Less Sugar and More Nutrients Than Other Leading Brands- (5 Year Shelf Life)
feature_bullets: Meets the US Coast Guard standards and made in America
Withstands Temperatures of -40° F to 300°F (-40°C to 149°C).

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars49 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
